website_summaries.verdict: Not as versatile as some other machines, but one of the most compact and affordable models available. A great deal if you don't mind focusing on just a few types of motion.
pros: A compact and rugged machine that's priced right and features 20 exercises
cons: Has no weights, so all exercises are of the "pull-up" or "dip" variety

customer_reviews.title: Missing hardware and broken plastic pieces on arrival, bowflex replaced every thing
customer_reviews.text: I have several Bowflex products. This is the first purchase that was missing parts. The hardware package was open and several bolts and washers are missing, and there are several extra bolts that are not needed. In addition, some of the plastic parts are broken. The large steel components feel very solid and I'm sure it will be fine once I'm able to get some hardware. I'll update once I get that figured out and use it. Update: Bowflex customer service was actually fantastic. I called and they immediately shipped all the missing and broken parts. I'm very impressed overall.
customer_reviews.author: J. STORMER

customer_reviews.title: Best equipment I've ever purchased
customer_reviews.text: This is the best piece of equipment I have ever bought. I've exercised for the past 30 years and have bought many types of equipment. This item will not only force you to do the real exercises but will help you get there. The chin up bar is low enough for you to cheat and jump up into position until you can bend your knees and really do pull ups. The adjustable dip bar allows you to do the same. And starting pushups at a 45 degree angle as a warm up then lowering it to do real pushups also helps. The thickness of the bars is perfect. I just love it.
customer_reviews.author: W. H. Klingler

customer_reviews.title: Quality issues

customer_reviews.text: The Bowflex boy tower is an amazing exercise tool. The cost is fabulous.l. And it fits in small places. Great purchase!
customer_reviews.author: lefty

customer_reviews.title: Strong Sturdy Tower
customer_reviews.text: Great buy! It has a fairly small footprint for what it does. Strong metal frame, coated metal, and good design.
customer_reviews.author: Demyars

customer_reviews.title: I'm very disappointed..
customer_reviews.text: I'm 5'11'' and 190 pound. Its not high enough to do pullovers. Also, it moves too much. I'm very disappointed. .
customer_reviews.author: Silva

customer_reviews.title: it'll do
customer_reviews.text: When we purchased this item, we thought that it would be taller. I don't remember reading anywhere that it was a little more compact than other towers. I also wish the pull up bar were a little wider. Wide grip pull ups are more like neutral grip. I am 5' 7" and it is just a couple inches shorter than I would like. For the price though it is pretty sturdy and decent quality. I like that you can move the dip bars up and down and also like that it has the sit up slings included.
customer_reviews.author: Cookie Malone

customer_reviews.title: So-So
customer_reviews.text: Well if you need a wider stance for like dips etc....stay away. I have done dips on it but it pretty much hurt for how narrow it was. I do like the adjustable back/dip bar....you will need to. it has to be at very bottom to do chin/pull ups.....overall it was ok. I expected better from bowflex........oh yeah and one screw was to short. I made it work without washer. Like I said I thought it was gonna be better. For a small/short person I believe it would be great. I am 6 feet tall and it feels so cramped. Maybe it just me.
customer_reviews.author: Flyspin

customer_reviews.title: It is awesome
customer_reviews.text: Simple, elegant, took up a bit more room than I expected but it is worth it. I really like the ab work I am getting on it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Addition to Home Gym
customer_reviews.text: The Bowflex Body Tower is an excellent addition to any home gym. It is perfect for P90X and other fitness routines that incorporate pull ups. Price/value is outstanding given product quality and stability. It took me two hours from product delivery to completion of assembly. Much of that time was spent unpacking. I am not mechanically inclined, but I found the assembly directions and process to be straight forward. Please note that to do the assembly you will need a step ladder. Equipment that you will find in a professional gym costs multiple times more than this and is obviously heavier and will tolerate more abuse. That said, for home gym application the Bowflex Body Tower is the right choice.
customer_reviews.author: Jim K

customer_reviews.title: Only thing I'm not satisfied with this product is it's not tall enough
customer_reviews.text: Only thing I'm not satisfied with this product is it's not tall enough. :-( Most pull up bar allows you to hang straight while doing pull ups where this one makes you bend your legs.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle nairne

customer_reviews.title: Solid and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: very stable, easy to assemble, very functional unfortunately have to face outward when doing dips otherwise you'll get a concussion hitting your head on the chinup bar handles are good for rows beware if ordering from amazon though, they have no respect for the box
customer_reviews.author: bxg24

customer_reviews.title: Good but could be better
customer_reviews.text: Not as great for pull ups with the weird angles on the bar, but is high quality and some nice features, should be a bit taller as well not good for anyone over 5'9
customer_reviews.author: Scott Bailey

customer_reviews.title: I ended up buying this Body Tower and I am so glad I did
customer_reviews.text: After doing a lot of research, I ended up buying this Body Tower and I am so glad I did. It is super sturdy, multi-purpose, looks and fits great in our basement, and easy to use. it's also comfortable for different heights/weights. I am 5'0 and can use it perfectly. My husband is 5'9 and he's also a fan. I also like the fact that it has the hanging armrests as I find them much more comfortable for some of the workouts I like doing.
customer_reviews.author: B. Dolan

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love the amount of exercises you can perform.Quality is outstanding.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wife loves it, Easy to put together and Well Built
customer_reviews.text: Product quality first rate, sturdy for pull ups, bars are comfortable. Dip bars easy to adjust once everything is bolted tight. Added a TRX strap to increase the number of exercises you can do with it. Nice addition to a basic home gym!
customer_reviews.author: William M. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: Love this. I can do so many different exercises. Although I don't have the upper body strenght to do all the lifting; it enables you to work up to it, which is perfect for me. Also it fits in the space I have right next to my treadmill and it's not a huge piece of equipment.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: best on the market
customer_reviews.text: First let me say that even for a large piece of equipment the assembly was very easy..took me and wife a little under 30 minutes. The instructions are very easy to read and follow. Machine is solid as a rock..im 6'3 and weigh 215 and have no issues. Feels secure while doing pull ups, chin ups and suspended knee raises. The fact that its a very attractive unit doesnt hurt either. Would recomend this unit to anyone looking for a great workout at a reasonable price
customer_reviews.author: FLDIVERJC

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: It's sturdy, takes up less space than you might think. The work out chart it comes with helps a lot and I'm excited just to see it in my living room, it motivates me to want to work out more often!
customer_reviews.author: Cj

customer_reviews.title: good so far @ 1 month
customer_reviews.text: This is the only body tower, I have tried so far and so am unable to compare against others. Also not yet tried all the positions. So far one negative, I experience is the height for pull ups is not enough, but manageable.
customer_reviews.author: Hari

customer_reviews.title: Bowflex Body Tower
customer_reviews.text: Item arrived very quickly. Compact height allows it to be set up in any unused corner.Gym quality finish on surface's.
customer_reviews.author: j.f.

customer_reviews.title: Good body tower.
customer_reviews.text: Lets me do body workouts at home for those days I can't make it to the gym. I attach my TRX straps to the pull up bars and work out with those just fine. Tipping is NOT an issue for me, but I use common sense and don't push my weight in weird directions. Simple physics bro. All in all I'm very happy with it. While it may not be the BEST out there, it is really good for the price.
customer_reviews.author: X

customer_reviews.title: Easy assembly. I'm 6'
customer_reviews.text: Well made. Easy assembly. I'm 6', and I wish it was a bit taller. I still use it, though!
customer_reviews.author: George Navarro

customer_reviews.title: Watch out for the shipping
customer_reviews.text: The box was a joke. Nuts and bolts falling out of it. Screws weren't in their respective places. Yes, it works but I was beyond disappointed with the shipping. It looked like all the smaller pieces were just thrown in willynilly. I had to buy bolts for it cuz there were holes on the box.
customer_reviews.author: Styley
